page.title: 18TRANSPORT IN THE GULVAL AREA
page.content: {Buses}are the only public transport serving the area. Services have been cut recently, particularly during the school holidays, and are less convenient. The{railway}line to Penzance lies just above the beach. Access to the beach is by a new footbridge across the line, or a level crossing. There is a locomotive servicing depot at Long Rock. The most convenient form of transport is a private{car.}Most visitors come by car. The A30 road to Penzance, which lies beside the railway, is very busy, especially in summer, when there are long queues of slow-moving traffic at times. There are plans to build a much-needed by-pass around Long Rock. The high density of summer traffic also brings hazards to users of the narrow winding lanes which are an attractive feature of the country-side
